title: Temple Hanging, 13th century (bodhisattva), 18th–19th century (hanging)
medium:
Medium: silk, metal threads
Technique: the bodhisattva is needle looping technique; the hanging is made from various woven fabrics sewn together
creditline: Museum purchase from Smithsonian Regents Collections Acquisition Fund
description: The central figure is a Bodhisattva made by needle looping in the 13th century. The figure was later sewn to a ground of Chinese light blue silk satin with a gold pattern of chrysanthemums on a curving vine. The standard is made from various woven silk and metallic brocades, sewn in tab-like forms to surround the Bodhisattva. A silk tassel finishes the bottom.

tombstone.epitaph:
Temple Hanging, 13th century (bodhisattva), 18th–19th century (hanging).
13th century (bodhisattva), 18th–19th century (hanging). Medium: silk, metal threads
Technique: the bodhisattva is needle looping technique; the hanging is made from various woven fabrics sewn together. Museum purchase from Smithsonian Regents Collections Acquisition Fund. 1987-7-1.
